description:
Solid 4 stars.

Our original plan was to go to Taco Tuesday at Nicks...but the line was too long, so we made a detour here. It was about 6pm and there were plenty of tables for 4 so we grabbed on and mulled the menu.

In our dumb luck the Tuesday menu includes fried chicken.

We were in the mood to split a bunch of stuff, and I think we really ordered the exact best things on the menu and the exact right amount of food.

We all had a glass of wine, the pours were fairly large.  We started with the Mac and cheese (added pepper) - It came in a caste iron skillet and the red pepper addition was only on top and it was fairly spicy.

Then we split: 
-the plate of fried chicken
-the small ravioli (4 pieces)
-The corn/goat cheese soufflé (I gotta figure out how to make that)
-The Brussels sprouts

The chicken was great - but that goat cheese soufflé is what I am still thinking about.

I would definitely go back. Splitting a bunch of stuff was a great way to go.

We did get the peanut butter ice cream from the dessert menu. It was good, but we didn't need it.  The total, including tax and tip was $35/person.
author: Amy W.

description:
tl;dr: good food, okay drinks,  closer to the $$$ range than $$

Came here at a 7pm on a Friday night without a reservation but did not have any trouble finding seating (for a party of 3).

I ordered a dark and stormy, which was dark in appearance, but not stormy enough in taste.

We also got the crisp flash-fried calamari, which contrary to other reviews, was below average calamari- too floury and not enough flavor (the sauce was good though).

I also got the grilled Hawaiian ahi, which was very good. 4 stars for this. It's a well-sized portion seared to perfection. The green beans, the mashed yukon potatoes and the aioli complement the ahi very well (although the three of these would have tasted wonderful even without the ahi).

Ahi was $23, calamari was $10. I'll probably return, but skip on the drinks and the calamari next time.
author: Karanveer M.

description:
Amazing food very friendly chef.
He came by to talk to us. 

Highly recommend getting the burger with avocado. It was nearly a half an Avocado. 

Only problem would be restrooms. Everything else is great!
author: Robin S.

description: Came in at a last minute to grab some dinner. This place is okay nothing special except for their buttermilk fried chicken sandwich. They use fresh not frozen chicken and it is just amazing. Good service a little quick to grab plates away from you even when you are barely done, it's like let me finish wait a minute then please take my plates. Overall it's was a good experience, definitely recommend coming here and trying out the chicken sandwich.
author: Roman L.

description: Everything we tried was great! Highly recommend the Prime Rib. You can't beat the quality for the price.
author: Alecia M.

description: On Sunday night get the fried chicken and pay the extra for the corn bread - Mac and cheese with bacon is a great starter - good friendly service with a great bar and a lot of home made deserts - only negative is there are too many tables for the size of the restaurant so you feel tight - great music playing for a good vibe - try it out - I think you'll like it
author: M O.

description:
An average place in my opinion. We were passing by with a group of 12 this past weekend and we decided to give this place a try since it was the least packed restaurant in the area. I really liked the atmosphere and the mood lighting, however I wasn't really pleased with the service. The lady who greeted us by the door didn't seem like she was in the best of moods. We asked for a large table so that all of us could sit together and were told to wait at the back of the restaurant, which I thought was really weird. It would've probably been better if we were just told to wait outside for a couple minutes. 

After waiting for some time, we were seated and given menus. There weren't to many choices that caught my attention so I decided to go with a simple burger. I asked to get the Street burger without a bun, in other words, protein style, but for some reason, received just a patty with cheese and veggies on the side. I'm generally used to getting lettuce instead of the bun, but I guess their version is not the same. Anyway.... that was quite disappointing. I also tried some of the big salad with roast NY strip steak and it was very simple. I would expect there to be some more meat and veggies because the salad just felt empty. 

Overall I feel like things could've been better. From the moment we were told to wait at the back of the restaurant by the kitchen, I was not pleased. Service needs major improvement and so does the food preparation and quality. Not sure if I'd want to recommend this place to many people.
author: Julia K.

description: Love this place... Great organic selection... Nice savory flavors.  Get the ravioli get the kale salad
author: Dubl A.

description:
I like Street.  The service at the bar and tables is friendly, although sometimes slow at the tables, and the decor is cool.  And it has one of the most underrated burgers in the city.  
On the burger: the bun is a bit big for the meat portion, but the meat portion is a good size AND was cooked perfectly to order (medium rare).  The meat was also seasoned well and tasted delicious.  The next time I go, I think I'll order it with blue cheese. 
I'd definitely be back for the burger.
author: Andrew D.

description: We had a restaurant.com certificate so we decide to use it. Looking at all the restaurants.com listed this ones stood out the most because it was not ghetto and it is actually in a very nice neighborhood the rating was really great and it's one of the restaurant on the list that isn't close or in the ghetto so I decided to go ahead and come here. I am so extremely happy with my decision for coming here. I had one of the most greatest experience as far as restaurant. #1 place was very nice, clean(very important) & very sheek. #2 Our waitress was Christa she was so sweet and so amazing she told me what the specials were and how their place changes menus every now and then which is very good to know for the next time #3 their food was so amazing and seasoned so perfectly. I would definitely go back there again we order the New York strip and it tastes like a filet mignon that was how good it was just full of flavor and melted in your mouth. I would definitely recommend this place!
author: Michele T.

description: I love the atmosphere here, it is cozy and feels like you are among friends. I enjoyed the crab cakes and my friend liked his burger. I would go back if I was on Polk and just wanted a low-key decent meal that wasn't too expensive or flashy.
author: Tracey K.

description:
My boyfriend and I were searching for the perfect restaurant for my birthday dinner. Well, ANY restaurant, really. I happened to have $25 in Restaurant.com credit, and Street Restaurant caught my eye, so it was settled. Needless to say, I was disappointed.

First, the food. We ordered a variety of food, starting with the Brussel sprouts and wontons, both of which were recommended by our waitress. The wontons tasted like something I could have pulled from my freezer, boiled, and dunked in soy sauce. They were slightly undercooked and did not have a special "Street Restaurant zing" to them. The Brussel sprouts were flavorless, which was surprising, considering how much cheese and chili paste were thrown on them. It was the vegetable itself that was not infused with flavor.

For my entree, I ordered the black truffle ravioli because it sounds amazing. It was also tasteless. I'm very stubborn about adding any salt or pepper to my food at restaurants, because I feel like it should already have sufficient seasoning... but I desperately needed salt to finish that dish. My boyfriend said I should include some constructive criticism about the food in my Yelp review, but that's really all I can say about it. The ribs that he ordered were saved by the spicy BBQ sauce they were marinated in but they, too, were dissatisfying.

For a restaurant that looks super upscale and classy, I was excited to try this new place, and I'm usually very forgiving. But we ordered quite a variety of food, and my experience with all the dishes was the same. I was especially looking forward to the peanut butter ice cream that I heard so much about, but I was not ready to be disappointed about DESSERT.

I'm not sure why this place has so many high reviews, but I certainly will not be coming back here or recommending it.
author: Stefanie C.

description: This place is great! Their drinks are tasty. Portions are small- if you're just a little hungry, you can down 1.5 dishes all alone. They brought us bread to soak up the extra calamari sauce, which was nice. Tried to get a good photo of the food but couldn't due to the sexy dim lighting ;)
author: Katherine G.

description: The food and atmosphere is nice.. but when paying for our bill, a waiter accidentally spilled sweet chili sauce ALL OVER ME. Like in my hair, down my back, on my clothes. The waiter was really apologetic about it, but when I tried to talk to the manager about it she was extremely rude. She abruptly said "get her address and have her send the bill," then stormed off. I understand that accidents happen, but management should have been more accommodating and apologetic.
author: Jenny B.

description: We had hundreds of restaurants to choose from but the reviews guided us here. It was Pride weekend and it was a Saturday night so we wanted to move away from the happy hour 20-30 something crowd. This place was perfect! Amy, the bartender welcomed us like we had been coming here for years. The cherry soda (alcoholic cocktail) was delicious after a long day of shopping. We started with the calamari. Lightly breaded and delicious. Then I had the bolognese and my hubby ordered the burger. My pasta was fresh and delicious and his burger was one of the best ever. He has ate a lot of burgers so that's says a lot! They treat you like a local and the food is amazing!!!
author: Amy T.

description:
Dropped in here to watch the Pats opener when I walked by & saw the one TV screen above the bar.  Game was so-so - but the house burger here may be one of the best in City!  I was torn between ordering the burger or the fried chicken salad - bartender made the right recommendation for the burger on my first time...looking forward to returning soon to try the fried chicken.
Nice space...Cool art on the exposed walls, lots of windows out to the street - and a cozy bar where we dined.  Very unique music - Street is perfect for a couple looking for excellent menu & friendly staff and ambiance.
author: Dennis S.

description:
My wife and I came here as she is celebrating a year post bi-lateral lung transplant at UCSF.
Amy took such good care of us and helped make it a great time. She makes you feel comfortable, like you've known her for years, I actually asked if she was the owner as she was so at ease -and that was before we told her about the reason we were there. Now we feel we have a friend there.
Then there is the food, we were looking for something special and not only did we get it but we feel both our dishes were worth much more, the kind of dishes you would expect at a high end restaurant. Fantastic, this place is a gem. 
Thanks Amy, we'll be back!
Jeff n Sue
author: Jeff M.

description: Not only did we have the chance to come on Sunday where they do their famous fried chicken but also we had a great staff from the waitress to the chef himself. All of us got that dish so can't tell for the rest but that was excellent.
author: Clem D.

description:
Probably the only consistent restaurant on Polk street. Seriously.  It seems so many places go down hill after being open for more than a year. 

Lightening, candles, music and cleanliness seem to be on point. Pet peeve of mine when these half ass establishments can't take the time to put soap in the bathroom or replace light bulbs, out of this or that... not at Street.   Food is always fresh and cocktails are made by a kind blonde always working the bar. 

Small menu and we keep coming back.
author: Robert M.

description: We tried this spot randomly and it didn't disappoint. The drinks and food were amazing and the service was great. Will definitely return.
author: Cristina P.

description:
OMG. I love this place.  We have been coming here almost four years.  Can't believe I haven't written a review yet.  Long overdue. We love it here and are regulars at the bar.  Highly recommend bar sitting.  Monica is the coolest bartender and the full menu is served.  Clientele is also friendly.  We often end up talk with others at the bar. 

Now the food and drinks. Amazing.  We get almost the same things all the time.  Start with fig martini - haven't found anywhere else that has this delicious. I also like the apricot one. 

For appetizer we get other the spicy hummus (not even spicy) or the foie gras.  Yum.  Then to salad.  The kale chicory salad is PERFECT.  Just the right amount of dressing cheese and super fresh kale and chicory. 

We usually get a soup. I am not even a gazpacho fan and I love it here.  It's got a hint of spiciness that make this soup really tasty and not overly salty. 

Lastly we love love the clam and shrimp linguine. Hand made pasta, perfect al dente.   Great blend of flavored.  

We have now tried the burger which everyone at the bar raves about.  Completely worth it. Also the Brussels sprouts.   Yum!  Lastly must get the truffle ravioli.  We got the appetizer side and then got another because it was sooooo good.  Highly recommend but pls don't take our seat at the bar.  Ha!
author: Lei H.

description:
I used the Restaurant.com certificate to find this place and found a new great place!

We had the wontons, spicy hummus, and big salad with the fried chicken. All were tasty, although the salad doesn't come tossed together (still tasty though). Another review mentioned it was healthy and affordable and I agree! To be fair, we didn't get dessert. 

Good beer selection, prices were on par with the neighborhood, efficient service. No complaints and we'll be going back!
author: Paul M.

description: This is a cozy restaurant with consistently tasty food. The décor is cool and the overall atmosphere is great. However what really makes this restaurant is Amy our waitress and sometimes the bartender. She makes it feel like Cheers- a neighborhood restaurant where everyone knows your name. She chats everyone up and it encourages a dinner party like atmosphere. If we have no plans on a Friday night, you will find us at Street.
author: Audrey M.

description:
One of those local neighborhood bar that I would find myself going to. Friendly bartender that will strike a conversation with you, make your drinks the way you like 'em, or even suggest something similar.

Great find, do check them out!
author: Owie N.

description: A solid choice for a dinner on polk st. I love their limited menu bc they truly do all their food items well. I would say go for the fried chicken it's so flavorful and delicious, not oily at all. Their cocktails could be a little less sweet but still makes for a great dinner spot!
author: Kaitna S.

description: The octopus!! I would definitely come back here again just for that appetizer. As for main courses, quality of the meat was solid, nothing was too dry, and the sauces weren't too sweet or too salty. Quality across the board was very consistent and I would definitely come back, which is rare for me to say particularly when there are always so many new restaurants to try.
author: Theodora C.

description:
We kind of splurged last night.Thankfully we had a coupon :) 
Everything was excellent overall, great food, great service , great ambiance 
I had the meat bolognese which was incredibly tasty. My wife had the the crab/salmon/fish cakes that she enjoyed, but not as much as my love for the bolognese. I could eat that dish forever. Appetizers were fried calamari which was yummy, not overly breaded and the mac and cheese which was rich, creamy, with a very strong cheese flavor. I needed a bigger bowl of that. 
We had the peanut butter ice cream which was out of this world delicious. 
Honestly I wanted to lick each bowl after everything that I ate. We need edible bowls.
Again we had a coupon so a 70.00 dinner , turned into a 45.00 dinner - whoohooo ! 
Without the coupon we could probably just get two main courses and probably still be content..basically full but not busting :) 
Portions were perfect for the average eater. For me I needed appetizers because Im not the average eater. 
Service was super friendly. Excellent lighting and candles to boot ! 
Easily recommended. My stomach was happy, yours will be too !
author: David S.

description: The shrimp and clam linguine was excellent, a very nice light sauce and light pasta. I didn't take a picture because the picture would not do it justice. The lighting in here is low but so is the volume, you can actually hear the people at your table and enjoy conversation with nice background music. I really enjoyed my meal here.
author: Amanda S.

description:
Great neighborhood spot for dinner! I like that they make most things in house and source locally. 
 
Musts that we ordered: 
Mac n cheese and the peanut butter ice cream for dessert! seriously order the peanut butter ice cream! Sooo good! It's the 4th star. 

Other items we tried:
The risotto was good but pretty rich with cheese and we also ordered the pork loin which was tasty. We had the chocolate cake and I could skip that next time.
Service was great!
author: Daniela J.

description:
Lynn and Bill are the couple that own both Street and Crave across the street on the corner.  

The love and care they have for this place shows.  The food is consistently good, the service friendly and attentive, and it's alway easy to find a table.  It's the perfect balance of bustling, yet quiet and accessible at the same time.

The quintessential neighborhood restaurant.

Head to Crave for great breakfast sandwiches in the a.m!
author: Dan W.

description:
I've been here a few times in the past, but this last meal I had was the best! I think they've really stepped up their game and nailed quite a few dishes. This is what we had:

1. Mixed organic heirloom tomato plate. Served with pesto and goat cheese. Super delicious!
2. Clam & shrimp linguine. Very well flavored and the homemade pasta was top notch.
3. Black truffle ravioli. I could have eaten two orders! 
4. Creme brûlée. Served with a side of sliced tomatoes and whipped cream. Not too sweet which is often the case with other restaurants. A great ending to the meal.

I think my favorite is the ravioli. You can order an appetizer size or entree size if you want to try more dishes. I will be back!
author: Lori M.

description: Excellent versions of Food You Like, well prepared in a nice location. Excellent service from intelligent and friendly waitstaff. The two of us enjoyed the Street Burger, which was fresh, large, juicy and flavorful. I'm not a fries person particularly but these were exceptional as was the burger. Do yourself a favor: Go To Street on Polk Street. You will enjoy your meal and appreciate the skill quite evident into their menu offerings.
author: Jean L.

description: Casual informal neighborhood restaurant offering great food, friendly service and reasonable prices.  Burgers in my opinion are the best in SF and priced at only $12.50.  When in the mood for a beer and a burger this is my go to place.
author: Bret M.

description: Pricey but good. the Brussel sprouts are to die for!!! we came in on a sunday adn got the fried chicken as well. good but to pricey for what it is. The server Amy was SUPER nice!
author: Desiree S.

description:
This is one of the best places to get a truly San Francisco experience. The food - always perfect, the ambiance hip and totally welcoming, but it's the Street fam- bartenders, waitstaff and chefs that make it a MUST. We come here almost every Friday nite, sit at the bar and feast. You should join the regulars - we'll make room for you. 
Faves include: Ceasar salad, NY streak, mussels, fried chicken and bread pudding. Every bite better than the one before.
author: Leslie W.

description:
Came in at 9 took forever to get seated and when we finally did they were quite literally out of everything. No fried chicken. No ahi tuna. No ribs. Great place if you don't want to eat food.

Add in snide comments from the single waitress about splitting the check and this is the easiest "never coming back" ever.
author: Andrew H.

description: Love this place. Fantastic food, great service and justified pricing. A great experience and a place I will be revisiting for years to come. FANTASTIC!
author: R C.

description:
I'm a bit ambivalent about this place. Used to come here a lot, and I really mean a lot. It was our default choice for that Friday night when you're in the mood for a little atmosphere and a good meal with alcohol, but were too busy during the week to make any plans. As walk-ins we usually ended up dining at the bar but that was just fine for our purpose.

Then the one time we actually planned ahead and brought a few friends in, the experience was bad. The food was good as ever, but after we finished our entrees and DIDN'T order desserts they couldn't wait to get rid of us. We still had half a bottle of wine that we wanted to sit at our table and enjoy, but after the plates were cleared the hostess stopped by 3 times inside 10 minutes (this is no exaggeration) to ask if she could get us anything else. After the third no, we were asked to leave the table and finish our wine at the bar. I'm sorry, what?!?!? Unacceptable.

After that, we didn't go back for two years, but recently have come back a few times, usually very improptu and based on friends' preferenes. And after all, we live nearby so it's convenient. I gotta say it's slipping. The appetizers and especially the steak entree used to be the best in the neighborhood, but the quality has stooped a bit. And apparently others have noticed this as well, becuase this formerly overbooked restaurant is now frequently half-empty.

As a basis for comparison I'd say 3 stars is reasoable, and that's without punishing them for that one horrible experience. The quality is still OK but you'll get more for your dollar a few blocks up or down the street.
author: Angela K.

description:
I have applauded Street Restaurant and it's owners, John and Lynn, in previous reviews. Lately, I have read media reports about the best hamburger in the Bay Area.  Failing to see Street on the lists, I can only think adequate research was not part of these reviews. 
The hamburger at Street is the best in the Bay Area and belongs on a National Best list. The Street burger is not piled high with a lot of distractions.  It is a straight forward burger. You can ask for one of several cheeses and request tomato, greens and pickle. 
Our guests become Street burger devotees after one visit. We are weekly or organization frequent customers. BTW, the entire menu is filled with great American food!
author: Patrick M.

description: Street is about the best neighborhood restaurant in San Francisco. Seriously delicious comfort food with a gourmet twist. Service is top notch, and the drinks are strong.
author: Mark R.

description: After having a not so pleasant experience at a place up the street we came down and saw Street!  Came in and were immediately seated.  Had the goat cheese soufflé and truffle mac and cheese to start.  They were FABULOUS!  The drinks were very strong and the service was fantastic.  We both got the New York steak and fries with the Gorgonzola cheese sauce- cooked to perfection and so very delicious.  We finished with the peanut butter ice cream magic- it is definitely as good as they say.  10/10 will return!
author: Megan C.

description:
Fantastic dinner. Looking for a date night and this place did not disappoint. 
Some of the lightest and most tasty fried calamari I have ever had. 
Great cocktails and a fantastic wine list. 
We will return when we are next in SF!
author: Andy C.

description: I love this place.    Monica and Amy are great bartenders.   The food is excellent and I think they have one of the best steaks in SF.    Much better than Izzy's!
author: Mark K.

description:
Had dinner at Street last weekend with a large group. We started off with the fried calamari and brussel sprouts. The calamari is very lightly breaded and deep fried to perfection! The brussel sprouts were very delicous! The right amount of spice. The fried chicken dinner is the best! Comfort Food! The black truffle ravioli is to die for!!! 

I have been going to Street for years and am never disappointed. The wine list is excellent. Street's bar is known for making outstanding cocktails.
author: Alice H.

description: The kennebec fries are to die for. This is coming from a Canadian by the way, so I've had my fair share of kennebec fries. The food is good and so is the service. Good vibes. Will be back for sure!
author: Zoe E.

description: Came here just for the peanut butter ice cream. My wife and I shared and it was the perfect dessert and amount. Home made peanut butter ice cream whip cream, caramel, peanuts and Came with a peanut butter cookie.  Yum!
author: Curtis C.

description:
I was craving steak, found this place, and realized it was really close to me! They didn't have a wait so we walked over to check it out, and I've decided it is now my go-to dinner spot. I almost don't want to review it because I feel like it's a new undiscovered gem.

The restaurant is small but the inside is modern and artsy. We started with the tomato plate (10.75) and it was fine, came with goat cheese and pine nuts. I ordered the NY steak with mashed potatoes substituted for fries (25) and it hit the spot!! I had to take the last bit to go. My sister got the Street burger (15 with toppings and fries) and she couldn't finish it either. We saved room for dessert though, and it was great -- a creme brûlée if I remember right.

Can't wait to come back!
author: Cynthia W.

description:
I planned a trip to SF just to have brunch at Tipsy Pig, but I will be back for dinner at Street!

We ended up here after deciding we wanted to end our night at Vertigo and walked along Polk looking to grab some food beforehand. We were immediately sat at a table for 3 against the window by a manager and greeted by our server, Carly, shortly thereafter. She helped us pick out a bottle of wine that we all loved and started us with the truffle ravioli appetizer. The ravioli is exactly what I will be back for. It was phenomenal; mind blowing; life changing! We then got a couple of mixed green salads (with perfectly cooked beets) and a Caesar salad. Followed by the Mac & cheese with chile which gave it a fun kick, and the paparadelle bolognese. Everything was great, but when I come back I'll be ordering the entree size of truffle ravioli and the Caesar.
author: Janee O.

description:
Meh, not incredible.

Food there is good but incredibly pricey for ridiculous portions (I'm a skinny guy and not a big eater though). Service was kinda slow and sloppy. 

Wouldn't really recommend but it's not horrible either!
author: Arnaud D.

description: This is the best down to Earth (Russian Hill) neighborhood restaurant and bar with consistently great food.  The family who owns it care about the quality of what you eat and the people who eat here.  There are some excellent menu choices (e.g. Homemade Soup from scratch) which are uniquely tasteful. It's best to eat at the bar if there's only one or two of you since it's quieter and you get to watch the chef in action.
author: John B.

description: We love Street. We recommend everything from the service to the food to the drinks. We went last night for dinner--the second time in two weeks. This time we had burgers and were not disappointed! Mine was done perfectly and went well with our champagne. Our server was attentive without being obtrusive. This is a great place to have a delicious meal with generous portions. It is our go-to place for Friday night after happy hour! We love the staff and ambiance created by Lynn and her husband.
author: Susan B.

description: I loved this place. The big steak salad lived up to its name. The mac and cheese was delicious as was the black truffle ravioli as an appetizer. The pappardelle was good. It gets a bit loud, but overall, great for casual dining!
author: Joanna S.

description:
Delicious dinner in a little space. Watch out for the draft on cooler evenings. 

We especially enjoyed the truffle ravioli, clams and crème brûlée.
author: Theo F.

description: Our first visit to Street began with a friendly welcome.  The dinner menu was interesting, the service efficient though not rushed and the food quite good.    The crab/ seafood cakes were excellent.   Place had a Parisian cafe feel to it.
author: David R.

description: Cute little hole in the wall restaurant! Have to admit, I have lived in the neighborhood for 2 years and just now discovering it! Really great food, great service and ambiance. Will definitely be back !
author: Kate M.

description:
YOU'RE GETTING THIS:
Big Steak Salad
Cheeseburger (best in SF and big enough to split)
Macaroni and Cheese
Meyer Lemon Cheesecake
Soup (yes, soup!  John makes the best soups in the city)

I've eaten at Street about 100 times since my last review.  The steak salad has always been excellent.  Love it with a side of Calabria chili sauce.  Very healthy!  Monica behind the bar is fun and great.  Lauren is a terrific server.  I always send out of towners here ("where do locals eat") and it's one of my fave restaurants in SF.  Lynn and John do a great job with this one.
author: Scott W.

description:
We were able to walk right in, request a table for 3, sit down, and order on a Friday night around 8pm. That was rad. The food was very delicious, but the portion sizes seemed a bit out of touch for the price point. Service was fantastic and the place was clean, music was enjoyable, and drinks were quick.

My brother and I both had the steak, which was cooked medium and was so tasty. Again, very good food, but the price per portion seemed a little in the restauarants favor. I'd go back, but I'd get soemthing a little cheaper.
author: Kyle O.

description: Great food, and possibly greater cocktails. These folks know how to cook meat (a dying art) and how to mix a drink. Lovely staff. The one downside is the noise level. The place is an acoustic nightmare. Not a place if you expect to hear your companion talk, but do not let it deter you. One of SF's hidden gems.
author: Lana N.

description:
**Review is for drinks only.**

After a horrible drink down the street, we came here. It looked promising, but it fell short of what we were hoping for.

The bartender was friendly and personable, and our drinks were ok, but nothing special.

This placed looks like a great neighborhood restaurant. Although not a destination restaurant, probably a good choice for people living in the neighborhood. 
If i lived nearby, I'd definitely come here for dinner. The menu sounded good, and they were busy pretty late into the evening.
author: Amanda G.

description: I have walked past this place thousands of times but never got round to going in. What a shame, because I have been missing out! Had the block truffle and butternut squash ravioli... Tasty! We actually needed nearly 1/2hr to decide on our meals because every single choice seemed ridiculously good. Cool ambiance, nice vibe and friendly service. Would be great for casual dinner with friends or a low pressure first date!
author: Kylie F.

description:
I don't understand the rating for this place on Yelp. 

We were a party of 3. Had a starter we shared and a main course and we were still hungry afterwards.

The fried chicken was just ok. Not bad, but not mind blowing. Just fried chicken. 
Very disappointing they serve it with corn and cole slaw (cheapo written all over it). 

The only things that satisfied us were the peanut butter ice cream & cocktails.

Definitely not coming back here because of the small portions, high prices and average food.
author: Judith S.

description:
Food was good. Unfortunately we did get seated at the table right by the door and an inordinate amount of people seemed to come in and out throughout the hour and a half we were there. Needless to say, we wore our scarves and jackets through dinner. 
A couple at a nearby table was seated and already eating when we arrived and still had not even packed up before our server had the audacity to ask US to give up our table. I pointed out to her that we hadn't even been there half as long as the other tables, she gave me a hurried apology and left. It was a disappointing answer to an already poor choice to ask someone to basically leave the restaurant where they just paid $75 for two salads. Obviously won't be going back and will make my experience at Street VERY PUBLIC.
author: Stephanie S.

description: Really great food and bar service. Missing the last sate due to ambiance and a cluttered layout. Will eat here again.
author: Olin H.

description:
One of my new favorite spots -- everything here is amazing!! We shared the black truffle ravioli, brussels sprouts, and truffle mac and cheese to start, and I got the bolognese as my main course. They really knocked it out of the park with every dish, and I don't say that lightly. I was starving and thrilled that everything came out fast.

The vesper cocktail is perfect.

Unfortunately, they don't take reservations.
author: Jia H.

description: Friendly, fresh, and we will come back a third time. Incredible burger on wonderful, special bun was delicious. my veal, pork, beef pasta was very enjoyable.  Heirloom tomatoes with goat cheese we will do at home. Sherryls mushroom and butternut squash ravioli in truffle oil she loved
author: Geanr L.

description: I came here on my birthday, after a walk on Baker beach and some oysters on the half at a different joint. I assumed it would be a great place, based off the ratings. My partner and I both got the steak and deviled eggs. Neither were good. The eggs were trying too hard to be fancy, they ended up not being tasty at all. The steak was average at best, and the fries that came with it were unseasoned and thick.
author: Nicole K.

description:
I've eaten at Street a couple of times. The first time I had the burger and sat at the bar. Tonight, my landlady took me out to dinner for the holidays.

They don't take reservations, so we took it upon ourselves to just stroll in around 7pm on a Tuesday. The place was moderately populated and we got a great table near the bar, far enough away from the front door to avoid the chill. In fact, I ordered a hot tea and the water was also lukewarm.

The service was general. Not particularly personal, not particularly neglectful.... util dessert was brought to the table, but more on that later.

We started off with the fried calamari app. My landlady immediately commented that the portion wasn't anywhere near what it used to be. It was also particularly lukewarm. In fact, all of the food lacked heat, like it sat a little too long on the kitchen counter before making it to the table.

For dinner I ordered the "Big Salad" with steak, medium well. This was basically a romaine salad with a creamy dressing. It wasn't big. Seriously, I'm not exactly a size queen, but if you're gonna call yourself "Big" make sure what you whip out measures up. This was a average sized dinner salad with avocado, radish and tomatoes. Now, this was a good salad, with a decent amount of meat and it definitely filled me up. I do feel like it could have had more lettuce and a larger presentation for little to no more cost.

I also added a side of fries, and I have to say, Street makes my favorite kind of fries. The are large cut with the skins on, not large enough to be steak cut fries, think larger versions of In & Out. The right amount of crunch and meat.

For dessert we shared the bread pudding with caramel sauce and pecans. Delicious!

Here's where the service tanked. Our dessert was delivered and we didn't see our server again for a long time. Now, this is not a large restaurant by any stretch of the imagination. 2 Servers work all of the tables in the joint. The service had been decent up till this point, but from the time we finished dessert to when we finally settled our bill, I could have solved Sunday's NY Times crossword puzzle.... And I suck at crossword puzzles.

All and all, not a bad experience, but there's definitely a lot of room for improvement here.
author: J. Scott H.

description: Great food for a reasonable price.  The presentations were great, as well.  I had seared tuna - delicious.
author: Randy M.

description:
The two stars mostly go to our server. She was very accommodating and sweet. 

Drinks were putrid - we ordered a cucumber martini and a basil lemon martini. They were both so bad we had to return both of them after one sip.
Food was barely good enough for us to finish. we ordered Caesar Salad (all we can taste is black pepper), Mac & Cheese (the Mac is very doughy), and a Clam & shrimp lingrine (the shrimp is very old and tough). 

Overall, Not a fan of this restaurant at all, and will never go back.
author: Joe W.

description:
LOYAL CUSTOMER N0 MORE

Went in with my girlfriend last week for after dinner drinks. I'd been coming in for dinners since they opened, years ago. She ordered a Fernat and I ordered a Mount Gay Rum over rocks. A nice bartender brought our drinks. I sipped my drink. It looked clear, like ice and water. My girlfriend said it was watered down. I knew it was ridiculously watered. She has been a bartender in San Francisco for 30 years. I agreed. I asked the bartender for a shot from the same bottle. There was no smell. We all drank it. It was 98 per cent... water. Definitely and very obviously watered down. So, the bartender opened a new bottle of Mount Gay at my request to pour a shot and compare to the watered down shot.(almost nothing left of the first watered bottle). Of course this was the real deal rum I should be paying for. My girlfriend said to me that she thought the owner/chef was watching us in a weird way. I'd noticed this, as well. I asked the bartender if I could take the near empty watered down bottle to the owner/chef as I thought he would surely want to know and surely see that I was trying to do him a favor, especially as he is the owner of Street. I'D put a credit card on the bar. I walked up to the open kitchen counter where the owner cooks. I politely said hi and how are you etc and said I thought he should know that the bottle of rum I placed on the counter was watered down and he might want to take a swig of what was left of the bottle. He looked at the bartender and said, "has he paid yet...?" She replied 'no, not yet'. He told her to cancel it. He then looked at me and said, "get the f... outta and don't come back..."  Holyeeeeeeee mackerel. I couldn't believe his response. If I was the owner I would have not only wanted to know his booze was being watered down, but, I would have thanked me and taken a sip of that bottle. I started walking and turned around at the end of the bar and looked at him in  disbelief and disgust... He repeated, "get outta here". He then something like he was coming over the counter and get me. I left. It was his turf. 
A very bizarre experience at Street... the most  bizarre experience in my 40 years in this great city.

 I should have called the police.
author: John J.

description:
Had dinner yesterday in this small restaurant.

Read just good things in yelp about it so i wanted to try it by myself.

Had a burger and the big salad with new york steak.

The burger was solid, tasty. 5*

The big salad wasnt as big as expected!;( and def. not enough to eat for this price! But it was quiet good and the beef very juicy! So i would give 3.5-4*
author: Markus S.

description: This was a great place! Awesome setting, fabulous food and excellent service. It's close to the wharf and marina district and certainly worth the trip over.  We had mac & cheese, brussel sprouts, goat cheese soufflé, pork chop, and topped it off with likely the BEST peanut butter ice cream!
author: Jen C.

description:
One of my new favourites in SF! Food was delish....we followed recommendations and got the 'Heirloom tomato soup' which was super tasty, and the mac n cheese with bacon which was also yum! We got the big steak salad, and a steak for our mains and they were both excellent. 
Also, the wine we got was great. It was the cheapest bottle of red on the menu AND it was a Californian wine which is great and is was super with our food....
Definitely try this place if you haven't already!
(also a bonus that its a few doors from The Buccaneer for a few cheeky pre or post dinner drinks!)
author: Kim M.

description: Food took forever and was very bland. Atmosphere was a little depressing. All in all I want my money back...Yelp you let me down for the first time!
author: Andru E.

description:
Great menu, portions an prices. Well done. 

Each antipasti is great for two.
The prime rib was a delicious feast.
The grouper fish was delectable.


I'll be coming back here for sure (a great date/fun spot)
author: Sabrina J.

description: I really can't find enough good things to say about Street. I am a regular here and stopped in last night with a couple of friends from out of town. The food here is always really terrific. But, with an out of towner, one is reminded how lucky we are to get to eat this food so regularly. John's an amazing and creative cook. We had the house made salumi, and ravioli as well as the brussel sprout appetizers. Each was amazing. I love the veal and pork bolognese with the house made papparadelle. It is my go to meal while my friends each had the crab cakes and were over the moon about it. Nothing pretentious, just amazing food.
author: Bob R.

description:
I came here last Friday night for a girls' dinner and had a great time. The place was full when we got there but the wait time around 7pm was only about 20 minutes, just enough time to grab a drink at the bar before being seated. 

My sister ordered the burger and loved it -- she did feel that the additional toppings like cheese/bacon/avocado were a bit steep, but she didn't regret ordering it after she was done. 

My friend and I shared the truffle ravioli, a clam and mussels dish in a garlic sauce and a tasty mixed greens salad. All were really good, but the clam and mussels dish stood out. We both wanted more bread just to dip in that amazing sauce. 

Overall, we really enjoyed it; the atmosphere was lively, service was good and we'll definitely come back.
author: Lisa A.

description:
I love this place. You know when you ask your server for suggestions and you get a bland response? Not here. Our server was full of feedback and very helpful.

My wife had the Dungeness crab and shrimp cakes, which were yummy, and I had the bolognese. The noodles in the bolognese were perfectly cooked and the sauce was extremely tasty. I can't wait to try other dishes here.

The atmosphere is casual, but still upscale enough to feel like you are treating yourself to a night out. There is obviously a lot of care put into the menu and service. Highly recommended.
author: Kevin H.

description:
When looking for a restaurant that is:

- Laid back and comfortable

- Not too fancy but not too casual

- Accommodating to all tastes with a well rounded menu

- Serves an incredible cocktail menu

Then Street would is a perfect choice for you. This Polk Street restaurant is great  for a dinner date or night out with friends. The staff and service are excellent - reservations are not needed but can be a good idea on a weekend. I'm in LOVE with the cocktail menu, the apricot infused vodka and pomegranate martini are to die for. The menu changes seasonally and always maintains an excellent selection of appetizers, small plates and entrees. Prices are reasonable allowing you to have a nice dinner without feeling poor the day after.

Street is a neighborhood restaurant that will leave you feeling happy and satisfied. I cant wait for my next meal and plan to become a Street regular :)
author: Caroline J.

description:
The burger was solid, as was my wife's buttermilk fried chicken (apparently a limited item). Nice cozy atmosphere, and really reasonable prices.

The peanut butter ice cream was fantastic, but it was with a peanut butter cookie. If they had put it with warm chocolate cake, I probably would be bumping this up to 5 stars on the strength of that alone.
author: David K.

description:
It might seem crazy what I'm 'bout to say. Sunshine she's gone, but you can still take a break. I'm a hot air balloon that could go to space With the air like I don't care, baby, by the way. 
Because I'm happy... Come along if you feel like a room without assholes. Because I'm happy... Clap along if you find like happiness is the true NY steak. Because I'm happy... Clap along if you know what the medium rare NY steak is to you. Because I'm happy... Clap along if you feel like that's what you want to do! 

Here comes good news, talkin' this and that. So Please give me all you've got, and don't hold it back Well, I should probably warn you, I'll be just fine, No offense to you, don't waste your time, here's why... 

Because I'm happy... Come along if you feel like a room without jackasses. Because I'm happy... Clap along if you feel like happiness is the great calamari. Because I'm happy... Clap along if you know what the calamari is to you Because I'm happy... Clap along if you feel like that's what you want to do. 

Bring me down... every thing... Bring me down...  your price is not too high ... Bring me down... every thing... Bring me down, I said (let me tell you now) Bring me down... every thing ... Bring me down... your food is so good ... Bring me down... every thing... Bring me down, I said... 

Because I'm happy... Come along if you feel like a room with a great service. Because I'm happy... Clap along if you feel like happiness is the truth. Because I'm happy... Clap along if you know what happiness is to you Because I'm happy... Clap along if you feel like that's what you want to do!

WE HAD A GREAT DINNER THERE! 

The 25 bucks medium rare NY steak w/ fires was perfect medium rare.
The 10 bucks Crisp flash-fried Calamari w/ spicy thai dipping sauce was so good! 
We had a bottle of Red Zin, 37 bucks, was really good, forgot the label but we have been to the vineyard for wine tasting few years ago.

We had a wonderful service. I'm glad we were back.
author: Nobu K.

description:
I have been here for million times, and this review is way long over due.
This restaurant is by far the best restaurant in the area, it's been around for 15 years and the owner John is such a pleasant man.
The food is always good, drinks are decent and the price is cheap.
author: Ty N.

description: The food at Street was average. They are unwilling to make any substitutions or additions and our waitress displayed little knowledge of the menu. The service was slow and our waitress was inattentive. I'm in SF on vacation but I wouldn't dine here again.
author: Caty Gray U.

description: Ate here last week. The server was really friendly and fun.  We had the calamari, which was as good as it gets. Also, the black truffle ravioli was really good. Prices are super reasonable for food this delicious.
author: Frank M.

description: Literally the WORST. First off, the waitress had zero opinion on ANYTHING which is crazy right? She couldn't recommend anything..red flag. When our appetizer came out, it looked like lunch meat. We couldn't eat it. When our main course came out, the portions were a bit small for the price, but we just hurried up as fast as we could just to get out of there. Terrible service and will not be coming back.
author: Alanna P.

description:
My lovely wife and I enjoyed yet another casual meal out at what is quickly becoming a neighborhood favorite of ours. 

The martini to start was very well made and poured, and certainly went down easily enough.

I do prefer Brussel sprouts pan fried to crispy perfection a la SPQR but have repeatedly ordered Street's par boiled or steamed version; probably due to the cayenne pepper aioli sparingly ladled atop the sprouts.

And then there's the wonderful hamburger prepared medium and charred; served with a side of crispy fries. It's well plated and will scratch that itch.

She who must be obeyed ordered the salmon atop greens and the dish seemed to hit the sweet spot as this was the second time in a row she ordered that main.

Street's decor, ambiance and atmosphere remind us of an Izakaya restaurant and that, to us anyway, is comforting.

The food of course has nothing to do with Izakaya. It is American faire, plentiful, tasty and served with a smile by a very friendly front-of-house staff.

Street is becoming a local favorite and we recommend you give it a go if you find yourself walking along Polk.
author: Jay D.

description:
What a pleasant surprise.  We were walking around looking for a place to eat and this popped up on yelp near us.
No reservation but they fit us in. It is loud.
But we were able to sit close together so we could hear each other. The food is what is so great about this place. Started with the house made salami plate. Yum. Then I had the salad with steak. So great.  Generous pieces of steak on top of a romaine salad. Just perfect amount of dressing. My husband had the lamb chops which looked beautiful.  We finished off with the peanut butter ice cream for dessert.  Incredible. And the drinks we has along the way were very well made from the bar.  Lots of couples and groups eating there.
author: Claudia M.

description: You do not have to be a regular here to be treated as one.  Very good food, friendly staff, fine folks.
author: joe r.

description: Once I heard that Streets Sunday Night Fried Chicken Special was some of the best around, I couldnt wait to try. Definitely lived up to the expectations.  Carly (spelling not sure) our server was an absolute doll and knowledgeable about the menu.   Started with a fresh salad with local cheese and greens. Followed by the Pork and Shrimp wontons that left you wanting more.  Next, the main event Fried Chicken.  Many sides including slaw, corn bread, whole kernel corn, mash pots and gravy.  We added the mac n cheese.  Two of us shared it all except one small piece of chicken, Which I wrapped in foil and put in my purse to later eat at the movie.  Dessert was also completely devoured...the Meyer lemon cheesecake and bittersweet chocolate cake (with vanilla ice cream) did not stand a chance.  Already planning next visit! Ever changing menu makes it exciting to see what is in store for that day.  A+
author: Molly A.

description:
I've been going back to the Street Restaurant for its tasty Bolognese. However, the service there, at least tonight, made me think twice about going there.

The portion of the dish today is really small. Okay, I understand the dish size has variability, but today's size is just half of what I typically get. After I complained to the waitress, she had a poker face and didn't say anything, and never returned. For the dessert and the check, it was the man who pour our water served us. 

It's on Polk Street where there're tons of other good options. Even for a good restaurant with a great chef, bad service is a real turn-off.
author: X L.

description:
3.5 Stars 

Came here for dinner on happenstance (being in the Russian Hill neighborhood). We did not have reservations but the wait for four was around 5 minutes on a Friday night at 8PM. Not too shabby. In those 5 minutes at the bar I felt like I was too close to a couple having their Dungeness crab cakes and so I felt intrusive and suddenly it hit me how small and narrow Street is. Other than that it felt very nice and intimate - a great place to have a date night. The dim lighting also added to the ambiance. However it was really cold still so I had to keep my coat on. 

Luckily the table for four was not cramped and tiny and we did have a lot of room at the table. Good service overall - the waitress was very friendly and happy to give her recommendations. 

My boyfriend and I weren't too hungry after coming from Amelie and having lots of tapas there so were shared the seasonal smoked turkey black eyed pea soup and an entree. It was very hearty and flavorful - hint of spice after taste that lingered. Kind of pricey for a small serving of soup though ($9)

For our main we had the Grilled Hawaiian Ahi Tuna which was yummy but not exceedingly remarkable. The fish was grilled nicely, the mashed potatoes were especially garlicky and textured (which I like) and the green beans were not too overcooked. It was a lovely meal and presentation but not a lot of food. 

Our friends got the fried calamari and the shrimp linguine but I'm allergic to shellfish and did not try those dishes. They were disappointed with the portions though. 

Although we did not call in I would recommend doing so just to see how long the wait would be because the restaurant got packed as we were finishing up our meal. Especially if you're a party of 4 or more.
author: Paula V.

description:
Came here with a group of 5 and 3 of the 5 of us were disappointed in our meals. The ahi was cooked completely through - barely pink. Both myself and my friend who ordered the ahi were confused and sad.

Another in our party got the NY steak and said it was horrible. It was a small piece, considering the price and title, and was a pretty fatty cut. The other two ordered the truffle ravioli and the bolognese pasta and they were happy with their orders. 

Drinks were great and the appetizers (calamari, truffle ravioli and Brussels sprouts) were yummy. 

Overall, probably wouldn't come here again.
author: Allison R.

description:
Definitely get the souffled goat cheese!  So fluffy creamy.  I was pleasantly surprised by how good it was.

Also good are the dungeness crab & shrimp cakes and the brussel sprouts.  This place redefines comfort food.  (I can't believe I just considered brussel sprouts to be comfort food!)

The aviation was a solid refreshing cocktail.  The dark & stormy not so much.  You're probably better off getting wine here.

Overall good place!
author: Riz W.

description: We found this place on Yelp when visiting San Francisco for the day. The Brussel sprouts are... Amazing! The service, atmosphere and food was all perfect. Also-- DO NOT MISS the peanut butter ice cream!
author: Kara W.

description: Excellent! I have had almost every item on the menu and never had a bad thing. The Street mixed grill is always solid, the bolognese is out of this world and the Sunday fried chicken makes Sunday an even better day of the week. If you live in the neighborhood, this should be in your weekly rotation! They serve till ten on the weekdays which is a huge plus. Great atmosphere.
author: Robert W.

description:
Fun drinks and a killer Ahi Tuna Salad!

I like the easy going vibe and consistent food/service.

If you live around Polk, check this place out!
author: Michelle K.

description:
To be fair, there are so many incredible restaurants in this city that this restaurant would truly have to stand out in order for me to return. And to be honest, I'm a little (a lot) bitter about the experience because they couldn't serve us coffee with our dessert because their coffee machine broke...TWO WEEKS AGO. In a city of coffee lovers, er...addicts, I wonder how they've not had a mutiny already. Anyway to the rest of the experience.

I ordered the New York Steak with steak-cut fries. The french fries were fantastic - crispy on the outside, fluffy interior. The $24 steak was on the tough side but the flavor was on the right track. My husband had the fried chicken. After spending 5 years living in the south, I'd have to say it didn't even rate, but his mash potatoes and gravy were good enough to ask for seconds!

They do make their own ginger ale if you are into that sort of thing.

They had a pretty good looking dessert list but I'm sad to say I cancelled my dessert order when the waitstaff told me the coffee maker was on the fritz and had been for the last two weeks. 

Hunh? No coffee with dessert? What restaurant does that? 

So two stars. One for the nice waitstaff and one for my handsome date.
author: Tracey L.

description:
For as simple and modern as Street is, I wish there were more places like this along Polk Street. 

Ambiance and noise-level are perfect for a casual but refined dinner out or date spot.  The cocktails are delicious and beautifully prepared.  My go-to is wine, but these cocktails are not to be passed up! 

I understand that they just changed up their menu, but from my experiences, here's what I'd order again should I have the opportunity :) -

1. Crab and shrimp wontons 
2. Steak salad (huge and very fresh ingredients)
3. Calamari
4. Burger

All in all, Street provides a great dining experience inclusive of the atmosphere, service, and food. Cheers!
author: Brianna M.

description:
Very excited to try this cozy New American spot on Polk, but was severely disappointed.

The food was very average-- good but nothing impressive or something you'd tell your friends about. Definitely not worth the pricey menu. I tried the risotto, fried calamari, crab cakes, and burger and they were all underwhelming.

Beyond the food, the atmosphere was almost as disappointing. The restaurant was very cold and uncomfortable from the door to the back. The wait staff was unfriendly and stoic, despite our attempts to enjoy the evening and make it a fun night for everyone.

I won't be back to Street.
author: Geoff R.

description:
Street is one of those prototypical, dimly-lit bar/restaurants that cater to the bro community on Polk, except that it's actually good.  They serve good old-fashioned American fare for the God-fearing patriot - classic dishes like burgers, steaks, mac 'n cheese and pork chops.  

The steak was a perfect medium-rare, as was the burger.  Prices are reasonable, and every member of the wait staff is carefully attentive.  This place makes me proud to be a goddamn American
author: Kevin C.

description:
Second time in the last month that I wandered in here.  SOLID 4 stars.  My buddy just moved back into the city, we were hungry, burger night at Goia was packed we jumped into Street.  

Waiter, super nice, asked about our drinking desires before my big ass hit the seat.  I like his style.  I wish I could remember his name but full disclosure, we had been doing some dranking.  We concluded that a bottle of red would be well accompanied by our Clams, Pot Stickers and Calamari...I know, Philistines drinking red with seafood..whatevs.  All the food was good, clams were delicisioso!  I could have taken a bath in that broth.  

Like I said, Solid.  They are a good go-to.
author: Mark C.

description:
As my friend and I left Street on Saturday night, we were discussing how many stars we would give Street on yelp.  Our initial impression was that it was maybe a good 3.5 star restaurant--the food was decent, we liked the atmosphere, and we were seated almost immediately.

A block into our walk, we had downgraded the rating to just 3 stars.  Before being seated at our table, we order drinks from the bar--we each got the house Cabernet.  I believe our wine was $13/glass, which was a bit more than what we were expecting.  We definitely wouldn't have minded paying for a $13 glass of wine if it was good, which this wine was not.  

Another block later, Street became a 2.5 star restaurant.  As the memory of the handmade pasta (delicious) faded, the memories of the slooooowww service crept in.  We ordered glasses of water at the beginning of the meal.  We didn't get them until we were done with our entree.  Seriously.  This was after 2 reminders.  They must have been short staffed or something, because it also took a while for our waitress to come and take our order.  She had walked past our table a few times, each time assuring us that she would be 'right with us.' Fast forward 15 minutes, and you know what? She was there.  -1/2 star

And finally, when we made it home, we realized our stomachs didn't enjoy the meal as much as we thought it did.  

Sorry, Street--we won't be eating there again.
author: Nellie T.

description: My family and I shared the Brussels Sprouts for an appetizer and the Hawaiian Ahi, and Mixed Grill plate for our main course. The Brussels sprouts and ahi were great but the mixed grill plate's pork chop was very dry. However, my family has had it on previous occasions here and said it usually is much better. The waitress was very nice and service was very quick.
author: Kelly J.

description: Great staff and great food. The prime rib was fantastic. The staff helped hone  in on what would fit my tastes.
author: Michael P.

description:
Street you really deserve 3.5 stars, but I had to round down since I couldn't help but notice how your server seemed to be rushing us through our meal!

You don't order appetizers in order to eat them at the same time as your main dish. You just don't. And we didn't tell you we were in a rush. So why did you bring us our filet before we had finished our calimari?? I know it is a small place, but no need to rush us....Kelly D. and I both love food so much, that we like to savor each bite!

Your pate was pretty good and came with awesome dijon mustard and toasted bread and some random pickled things too, definitely a good way to start our meal. Your calimari which we heard from many others was supposed to be really good actually was just average. A little too much breading and it tasted a little too fried or something.

BUT THOSE POTATOES WITH GRUYÈRE CHEESE IN THEM??? My god. We were scraping the plate with our forks to make sure every single little molecule of this amazingly delicious side dish paired with our filet mignon and two HUGE prawns. There should have been a few more string beans I think, and the steak was not the biggest in the world, but they actually cooked it medium rare which we definitely appreciated! 

Oh and if you come here on a first date or something, don't. It is SO loud in here since it is pretty small, that we found it hard to hear each other at our tiny table for two. So just an FYI. Very cool interior though and very dark, in case you need to set the mood early I guess? ha
author: Sarah G.

description: Amazing! I had the souffléd goat cheese custard with mixed lettuces and tapenade crouton. My friends had risotto with wild white prawns, red chard, basil, reggiano and truffle oil; the short rib and a lamb dish. Paired with some red wine, good laughs, excellent ambiance and service and DELICIOUS (we tried them all) desserts, I would highly recommend this great spot on Polk.
author: Natalie H.

description:
Small restaurant, great food.

Sat at the bar for dinner. Service was prompt and friendly.

Appetizer: fantastic mac and cheese! Dinner: pasta with beef in some kind of French sauce (apologies for the vagueness: this was a couple weeks ago, and I'm not exactly conversant in all the sauces of French cooking. The word "bouillabaisse" keeps coming to mind, but that's a stew, not a sauce).

Also, relatively inexpensive by San Francisco standards.
author: Joseph A.

description: Great food, great cocktails, great service. We had a large group, but the food and service were still tremendous. Highlights were calamari, wontons, steak, mixed grill and desserts.
author: Troy D.

description:
Heaven in the form of peanut butter ice cream!

My girlfirend and I came here for some food and drinks on a Thursday after our workout and we couldnt stop ordering the yummy food!!
Hummice appetizer- amazing
Heirloom tomatoe plate- amazing
Truffle mac and cheese- we died!!!
chocolate cake with house made peanut butter ice cream- YOU HAVE TO TRY IT!

The waitress was great and friendly, service was speedy, and ambiance was really cool and cozy.
LOVE IT! 5 stars!
author: Angela I.

description:
Our night at street came after cocktails at Bourbon and Branch and a destroyed plan to go to Leopold's up the street. We alked by and looked at the many and thought that the menu looked good, so we put our name in and stayed outside to chat and walk around a bit. The hostess quickly tracked us down and offered us seating at the bar, if we didn't want to wait the whole time. We took her up on this offer because it was arctic outside and we aren't polar bears.

Sitting at the bar was a great experience because we really got to chat with our server, Monica and get her recommendations about what to eat. Monica recommended the mac and cheese with the Callabrian peppers. We got that along with the spicy hummus plate. Both of these dishes were very good, but not mind-blowing. The mac and cheese had great flavor and the peppers are really like hot sauce. The spicy hummus was a good hummus with nice sides like roasted eggplant, olives and tomatoes.

For my main course, I had the sweet corn risotto with tomatoes and rainbow chard. It was amazing. The risotto was perfectly cooked and the chef managed to really highlight each component so there was a really nice balance between everything. 10/10, would eat again. My friends had the crab cakes, the burger and the bolognese. I tried the fries from the burger and they were amazing. Super thick cut fries, but really crisp -- a feat rarely accomplished. Everyone loved their dishes.

I would rate the food as being very good, but the service from Monica really set the experience over the top. She was great at giving us recommendations and really snappy service. She paced the meal exactly as we needed and made conversation with us in a perfect manner. Monica, you are awesome.
author: D M.

description:
I live about 4 minute walk from this place. They DO NOT take reservations by the way.

Me and my boyfriend decided to try this one late afternoon. We both started with a cocktail. I order a watermelon cucumber which was very refreshing. My boyfriend got something with basically just vodka and orange slices and he enjoyed it even though I didn't care for it.  I got the pasta special and he got some pork dish. Overall fabulous!
author: Jess O.

description:
Street is one of the many restaurants on Polk St. It is located in a fun area to walk around, with lots of shops and cafes.

We had the Prime Rib, which was quite good, and made better with the yummy horseradish sauce. The Grilled Hawaiian Ahi was tasty, although cooked a little more than we wanted (we were expected something closer to seared - maybe our mistake). The highlight was definitely the Peanut Butter Ice Cream for desert - made in house, it wasn't too sweet. The warm chocolate cake was also good and satisfied my girlfriend's chocolate craving. 

With a glass of wine each, the whole thing came to $80.

Overall, the meal was delicious, and the setting was nice. We will be back to try the crab cakes and burger, which we saw go by as we were seated and looked great as well.
author: Alden Q.

description: Stopped in for a drink with a friend. We sat at the bar and had a nice large glass of sangria. Staff was friendly, ambience was great. Would come again to try the food!
author: Siv L.

description:
Always one of my favorite comfort food places in SF.  The best fried calamari around, light and delicious.  Really good burgers, pastas, salads, etc., everything homemade and absolutely delicious.

Great little bar that you can eat as as well with really cool bartender and excellent home infused vodka cocktails.
author: Randy P.

description:
I do my best to judge restaurants on what they promise and how they measure up to that promise. Street doesn't pretend to be anything more than it is: a casual neighborhood restaurant serving comfort food, done perfectly. It's not gussied up or pretentious, but has the self-confidence to be what it is, and I love it for that. 

I make Street my go-to for a quick weeknight dinner with a friend or a bite to eat alone at the bar (service in either case is friendly and attentive). A few of my favorites:

Fried chicken with homemade mashed potatoes, a deep, meaty gravy, fresh corn, and cake-like cornbread is only served on Sunday and Tuesday but always hits the spot.

The steak salad, which is dressed with a nice lemony dressing, big slabs of flank steak, and potato chips for croutons. 

Shrimp and crab cakes, topped with a corn and bean salsa, and medium-cut, perfectly cooked fries. 

Across the board, you can't go wrong.
author: Andrew D.

description:
This is a wine bar with great food and a diverse menu. It is small and dark inside, and on a weeknight, crowded. The staff was good about letting us pick our table though.

About the diverse menu, we had wontons as an app, along with Calimari. The entrees are in the $15-$30 range. For my meal, I had the burger and it was great. The bun was soft and glossy and the meat was cooked perfectly. Their wine selection was also vast of course and they had half bottles of certain wines.

Although it was crowded, we took our time and did not feel rushed.
author: Steve V.

description: So stoked that my girlfriend and I came here to eat. Food was delicately prepared with love.
author: Alexander G.

description: We came in here as a group and were all very underwhelmed by the food and service. I'm not quite sure how this place has such a high rating, but I know that we won't be returning.
author: Captain B.

description: Mediocre food that took forever to make. Ordered the calamari appetizer first which took about 5 minutes to get to us. But time between ordering and getting the entrees was more than 30 minutes. We ordered the steak and bolognese which were both ok. Service was excellent and atmosphere was good but ... Maybe the kitchen was experiencing some issues although I've also read in other yelpers' reviews about the excessive time it takes for the food to get on the table.
author: Ruby C.

description: Been dining there since the beginning, and it's fantastic!  I'll never forget the Sunday evening I walked in, looking forward to the buttermilk fried chicken Sunday special, only to smell something even better from John's kitchen:  overnight baked beans and pork belly.  You cannot go wrong, and even my New England in-laws feel that his fried calamari is the best any of us have ever eaten!
author: Steve R.

description:
Their food made me sick unfortunately. I had the crab cakes and threw up when I got home. Not returning, one bout of food poisoning was enough for me!

The reason I gave it two stars is because the crab cakes tasted really good going down. Not so good when they reappeared :(
author: Stephanie D.

description: This place is a must if you're on the fence. Their staff is friendly and great. I don't normal enjoy cocktails but took a chance with the Dark & Stormy a dark rum with ginger soda, it did not disappoint and went very well with my meal. Their Pork & Shrimp Wontons appetizer is scrumptious! I had the Dungeness Crab & Shrimp Cakes and the huz had the New York Strip. Both were explosions of deliciousness in our mouths. We are full and satisfied!
author: Mrs G.

description:
We were wandering around Polk Street looking for a place to eat on a Thursday night, and we walked into Street thanks to fellow Yelpers. We actually walked right past the restaurant the first time around because it looks like a sports bar from the outside. 

Food: Everything was surprisingly delicious. 
-Lamb chops & sausage: My fiancee loves lamb chops and this is one of his favorites of all time. Tender and juicy with a savory peppercorn crust. Served on a bed of super creamy mashed potatoes. They were a bit stingy on the 2-bite sausage though. 
-Egg fettuccine with dungeness crab & sausage: Oh how I love homemade pasta, perfectly cooked fettuccine, amazing tomato cream sauce, drool worthy spicy sausage. Dungeness crab was lost in the mix. 
-Homemade country pate: Earthy, grainy, meaty pate served with crunchy garlic toast and some of the best pickled veggies I've ever had. They could have been more generous with the portions here too. 

Service: Nice, friendly, made us feel at home.

Atmosphere: Small, dimly lit, unassuming, cozy. We were seated at 7pm, and there were only a few other diners. By the time we left around 8:30pm, the place was packed and getting a bit noisy.
author: Connie C.

description:
I ordered the fried chicken with mashed potatoes. It was a generous portion with 4 pieces of chicken, a large helping of mashed potatoes and gravy, a small ramekin of coleslaw.  The chicken was overcooked and little dry but had a nice flavor.  

My friend had the burger and I tried a bite, it was pretty tasty. We also shared a big bowl of fries and had a couple of Sculpin IPAs.
author: Christy Z.

description:
It is a small place on Polk which is a busy corridor for restaurants and wine bars. I had the fried chicken which was fine. The mash was superb, but overall it was just a mediocre meal. Nothing particular wrong with anything, but not much to write home about either. My foodie friend, Sara, would say, "meh"

Pricing was a little steep considering the quality of the meal. Drinks were hefty but expensive. I would recommend this place if you're local but I would temper expectations.
author: Paul I.

description:
Summary: this place has delicious and unique takes on some staple food favorites complimented by impeccable service.

I dropped by for an early dinner around 6:30ish; there were only a handful of tables with people and a few folks seated at the bar. I ordered the fried calamari to start and had the crab+shrimp cakes for my main course.

I scarfed down the delicious calamari--they were excellent! the house sauce for the calamari was unique and yummy. The crab+shrimp cakes exceeded my expectations; they were quite unique with the corn salsa topping and tomato underneath. I enjoyed every bite!

I hope to return soon :-)
author: Matthew J M.

description: Great neighborhood restaurant where the owner/chef cooks everything himself. While all of the food is good, it's by far my favorite burger in San Francisco. Great service as well!
author: Brian K.

description: My wife and I like to try different restaurants.  The one restaurant we keep going back to is Street.  The service is great and the food is consistently excellent.  The owners are friendly and truly care about their customers and staff.  My wife often orders the steak with mashed potatoes - it is great and at a very fair price.  She also craves the burgers and they are always cooked right.  I liken the crab and shrimp cakes, the tuna and the linguini and clams.  I can't say enough about Street.  If you try Street, I guarantee you will be delighted.
author: Ken S.

description:
T'was my boyfriend's birthday last night and it was the perfect spot!  It was a little past 9:30PM when we arrived and the waitress informed us (kindly I must add) that the kitchen was closing up in about 15 minutes (closes on Thursday's at 10PM) but never hassled us about choosing quickly like they do at many restaurants.  Everything was very prompt and yet amazing!  I was sure that the food was "iffy" because it arrived so quickly after our rather tasty Martinis.  My boyfriend had a regular Lime Martini while I had the Fig, which was rather delicious.  It made me remember why I love Martinis so much.

The food was absolutely delicious.  He ordered a pasta dish with large pasta noodles and pork, beef, and mushrooms.  I ordered a burger since I wasn't in the mood for the NY Steak I'll be ordering next time.  I have to say, I've had a lot of burgers in my life and this was easily top 5.  I'm sure it was partially because of the perfectly toasted bun but mostly it was the meat.  It felt like every bite I took, two more bites worth of hamburger showed up.  It didn't look as big as it tasted!  Does that make sense?  Anyway, I actually couldn't finish it!  I pushed it, as well.  I was full about 5 minutes before I gave up.  The salad was huge too.  It was fantastic portions for one place!

Pricing was fantastic for location.

Oh yes, the ambiance!  It was small, which made it nice and casual and not a lot of conversations you feel like you have to scream over.  The art on the wall was fantastic mixed-media on canvasses.  They had a theme that showed a lot about the artist.  They didn't have signatures so I have an idea that someone who works there created them.

This may sound funny to you but there was a red light that panned the very front of the place on top of the door.  It was small but it projected a slightly red glow over us and our table and was oddly soothing.  The lighting was rather low other than that but I'm a fan of dim lighting so was definitely happy about that.

I truly felt like I was in a cute, nice but casual, out-of-the-way restaurant in a big (although may seem small in diameter) city.  I love living here and this place just added to that.

Oh, sadly one detail that I forgot to mention--I don't know if their heater was broken or if it was just so chilly outside that it was on but you couldn't feel it.  Like I mentioned, it's a cozy, small venue so when the door opens and it's cold outside, a big breeze is going to take over for a second but either way it was slightly uncomfortable from time-to-time.  Dress warmly in the evening.

Well, my novel of a review now comes to a close.  I don't know if Street is consistently as great as last night or if others will find it as enjoyable as I did.  All I know is that my boyfriend and I had a blast and it was a very wonderful addition to his birthday.




I can't believe I couldn't finish a burger... so perfectly and deliciously filling...
author: Timothy R.

description: I've been going here for years and street has never disappointed. By far the best Burger in the city, but anything you get will be damn good.
author: Sergei S.

description: Came in late on a Tuesday night around 9:30pm with two friends for my last meal before leaving SF for a few months. We were promptly seated and all the tables/chairs were arranged in an intimate fashion. The server was polite and recommended the sausage plate, which I ended up getting. It was delicious and the portion was sizable! My friends got the risotto, which I tried. It was extremely well prepared - one of the best risottos I have tasted in a while. The dark storm is the drink of choice for anyone who is a dark rum lover like myself, and it couldn't have been better. The decor, atmosphere and music all matched to provide a cozy and intimate dining experience. Extremely pleased with the food, restaurant and service.
author: Rahul B.

description:
I wasn't feeling well and wanted some good comfort food to wind down my day and came across Street on Yelp.  I got the tomato soup, the calamari appetizer, and meyer lemon cheesecake with raspberry sauce to go.

The soup was fantastic!  I'm pretty picky when it comes to soup, and I have to say this was the best tomato soup I've had in awhile! It tasted so fresh!  I took off a star for the calamari because there was nothing special about it.  It was tasty, I could've done without it though.  The dessert was my favorite part! Yum, you definitely need to try that, it was tasted creamy and delicious! The setup of the place is small and cute for a date night.
