I tried the yellowfin tuna, quality didnt strike me as immensely fresh, it was really small proportion and most importantly just wasnt cooked that well.  I tried the gf's potato gnocchi and sausage, average at best.  Sausage was the highlight.  Only reason why i didnt give this place 2 stars was because of the deserts.  Tried 3 different ones from the menu, all of them were solid.
author: Charles C.

description: My boyfriend and I have started this whole Sunday night dinner thing--find a new place to try in the hood (or in some other hood), and have a chill dinner. Street was perfect for that this week. We'd been craving calamari, and they had it, which was a plus. The sauce it comes with is a thai spicey sauce, more tangy than spicey, and a different take than the usual cocktail sauce, yum. I had the King Crab and Shrimp cakes--they were very tasty, with a delicious corn relish on top, and placed on tomatoes instead of a bun. My boyfriend had the New York Strip with Gorgonzola Butter--while inventive, and interesting, we decided the steak was better with out it--still very enjoyable and we  both cleaned our plates. Oh and the waitresses were SUPER nice, let us swap out fries and be a bit healthy, and just kept checking up on us etc. Gotta go back for the Sunday night fried chicken dinner, apparently it's amazing, they were already out of Chicken by the time we got there at 7:45! Desserts looked good, but we didn't have any bc we were stuffed.
author: Aly S.

description: Street reminds me of Raoul's in Soho, which I used to frequent.  Comforting food in a neighborhoody kinda place (thought Street's menu is more eclectic).  Loud and fun (but without the annoying smoke from the table next door).  My favorites are the steak and fries, which are truly some of the best in town.  I also like the fried chicken dinner on Sundays.
author: Wally B.

description: I went to Street for the first time last night and was quite pleased. the restaurant was full which is normally a good indication of its quality. All four of us had the steak and fries. good but not super. a little too much butter but the fries were good. no delfina fries but still enjoyable. we had excellent service and the prices were reasonable. i wouldn't go out of my way to eat at Street but it is a very good option if you are in the area.
author: Stephen D.

description: Best hamburger in town.  My husband and I always split the hamburger and crab cakes.  Bread pudding and hot chocolate cake are great.  It's fun to sit at the bar with the regulars.  Nice ambiance although the noise level is high.
author: E H.

description: This is my favorite stand by restaurant in San Francisco!  The Burger is AWESOME, the fries are the best, the fried chicken is great.  My favorite, which I've only seen once is the meat loaf.  It put me in a food coma for about 7 hrs, but it was worth it.  Lynn and John are really great and this place is just solid.
author: Grant M.

description: I have been here twice with girlfriends before heading out for the evening and this is the perfect place to start your night!  The food is delicious and the pomogranite martini's are our favorite cocktail.  Best of all, the energy in this place is a perfect warm-up to a fun night out.
author: Amanda M.

description: This place is my neighborhood favorite, I eat here 3-4x per month and never, ever tire of it. The menu does not change too much, but more as of late they are adding new dishes to the menu which have all been great. You cannot go wrong with the Sausage or the Rock Shrimp/Crab cakes and their french fries are wonderful, the big solid kind. Also, the service is terrific and friendly. The owners are always on premise and their bartenders are welcoming as soon as you come through the door. Zero pretense.
author: B.M. B.

description: What would I do without Fried Chicken Sundays?  What would I do without Mangorita's (actually I know what I'd do - I'd wake up on Monday morning minus hangover after I had 3 too many....).  Street is awesome - it may look romantic and cosy from the outside, but eating at the bar is a chill night out if you are with a few friends.  And of course, if you are looking for the romantic and cosy, well this place has it in spades.  Just um......say no after your 4th Mangorita will you? :)
author: Olivia S.

description: Yummy! I live around the corner from this place and it is a definite must. The food is delicious. My favorite is the crab cakes. If you love a good order of french fries then you must try this place. The staff is wonderful too!
author: sara N.

description: This place is so real.  Everyone was so friendly, and although they were slammed, both the hostess, Lynne, (owner, by the way) and the bartender were  ready to make your night good.  We had a few drinks, real drinks, served by a friendly bartender, Amy, who made us feel like family.  She recommended a syrah for us that was affordable and delicious, then we were seated and had a great meal.  The wontons were so great, but we needed more, so our waitress said hummous and pate were the way to go. Dead on, she was, and then we had risotto, steak, and two burgers. Sublime, and the spinach salad was the best ever, real bacon, egg, and good spinach leaves, not wilted. I think this place is a well kept secret, and its worth whatever wait. Theres a bunch of bars on the street, and if you dont want to hang at their bar, they will call you when your table is ready. Great place!
author: Kevin C.

description: For my opinion this place just OK!!. drink it's ok food is naaaaaaaaaaaaaaa dont order calamari!! it's very salty =. Drink is good. overall is ok.
author: Grace C.

description: The food here is mediocre at best. The service, abominable. The clientele, potentially even worse. Here for dinner last week, a rude woman from the bar stopped by our table at the end of the night to interrupt our meal and tell us off. They won't seat a partial party, but they will if you have small children. They tell you they won't put 3 people at a table that seats 4, so seat you at a table made for a romantic date, and 10 minutes later seat a party of 3 at a table for 4. And did I mention the food was only mediocre? The drinks, okay, but mostly because they coat the edge of the martini glass in so much sugar it's hard not to think it tasted good. All in all, not very impressed.
author: i p.

description: I went to Street tonight with some friends because I heard the food was good and when I drove past it a couple weeks ago it looked packed inside. To my utter disappointment, not only was our server cold and inattentive, the food was terrible. The pork and shrimp wontons were less than mediocre (you can find that exact flavor in any substandard Chinese restaurant).  The penne was salty and though it had flavor, it was not good.  The expensive ahi was overcooked and the chipotle sauce that came with it was the opposite of delicious.  Against my will, my friends ordered dessert.  We ordered the apple cake and the bread pudding.  They basically gave us the SAME dessert, except the apple cake had ONE piece of apple, and the bread pudding was a tad bit softer than the apple cake.  Other than that, there was no difference between the two desserts. It was quite ridiculous. In conclusion, I would never ever recommend this place to anyone!!!! Don't go there! Don't waste your money!!! There were four of us and we ended up spending $143.00 not including tip.  We were unsatisfied and short $143.00. Let's just say the person in our party that chose this restaurant owes us big time (he happens to be my husband).
author: esther Q.

description: have been to street multiple times and had great food and great service. it is not cheap but the food is of pretty good quality. came here last evening wtih friends from out of town and after 4 days of eating over thanksgiving we asked the waitress if we could switch out fries for a few greens etc. prompt response was no there was not enough left for others in the restaurant (even though this was at 7:00pm). i asked for salad with my burger instead of fries and got the same response but i could purchase a salad from the appetizer list; incidentally my app. salad ended up being 8 bucks.. i was surprised as i have switched out fries for salad/greens before with no issue. waitress was friendly enough but totally inflexible which i could understand if prices were cheap; but they are not. sadly i won't be going here again and will not be recommending friends to eat there. not sure whether staff was new or there is new ownership here but it was very surprising having eaten there multiple times with very accommodating staff. for any restaurant these days customer service is king and sadly this was not a regal moment for Street.
author: Oliver P.
